extendedIngredients.name: bacon
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 strips bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled

extendedIngredients.name: pizza crust
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (13.8 oz) Pillsbury® refrigerated artisan pizza crust with whole grain

recipes.title: Bacon, Jalapeno and Tomato Pizza

winePairing.pairingText: Pizzan on the menu? Try pairing with Sangiovese, Barbera Wine, and Shiraz. The best wine for pizza depends on the toppings! Red sauce pizza will call for a red wine with some acidity, such as a barberan or sangiovese. Add pepperoni or sausage and you can go bolder with a syrah. One wine you could try is Madsen Family Cellars Sangiovese Wine. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 26 dollars.

productMatches.title: Madsen Family Cellars Sangiovese Wine
productMatches.description: This wine has a pronounced nose with a hint of coffee while your mouth is invaded with spices; clove, licorice, and cinnamon.The palate features cherries and notes of clove which continue on to a smooth, long finish with subtle oak, slight pepper and berry flavors. The tartness of the wine works well with food as Sangiovese is a food wine, but can be enjoyed on its own as well. Columbia Valley AVA from the vineyards of Jordan Reed.

recipes.instructions: Heat oven to 400°. Roll dough out onto cookie sheet and press until desired thickness. Spread pizza sauce on top of dough and then sprinkle 1 1/2 cups of the cheese over sauce.  Top with remaining ingredients and finish with the remaining 1/2-cup of shredded cheddar cheese. Bake pizza for 18 – 20 minutes, or until golden brown around edges. Tips:For extra heat, add a few sliced fresh chili peppers. To make a mild version of this pizza, replace the jalapeno peppers with bell or sweet snacking peppers.

steps.step: Roll dough out onto cookie sheet and press until desired thickness.
Spread pizza sauce on top of dough and then sprinkle 1 1/2 cups of the cheese over sauce.  Top with remaining ingredients and finish with the remaining 1/2-cup of shredded cheddar cheese.

Bake pizza for 18 – 20 minutes, or until golden brown around edges. Tips:For extra heat, add a few sliced fresh chili peppers. To make a mild version of this pizza, replace the jalapeno peppers with bell or sweet snacking peppers.
